Description: Use the ad auth command to authenticate the user against Active Directory. This command manually checks against Active Directory to indicate whether or not a username and password are valid.

Description: Use the ad netjoin command to join the host to the domain.

Description: Use the ad netleave command to remove the host from the domain.

Description: Use the ad passwd-server command to do the following tasks:
Preprocessed_Description: ad passwd-server use ad following tasks

Description: Use the ad testjoin command to test if the ad netjoin command succeeded. This command also tests whether Policy Manager is a member of the Active Directory domain.
Preprocessed_Description: ad testjoin use ad testjoin test ad netjoin succeeded also tests whether policy manager member active directory domain

Description: Use the alias command to create or remove aliases.
Preprocessed_Description: alias use alias create remove aliases

Description: Use the backup command to create a backup of Policy Manager configuration data. If no arguments are entered, the system automatically generates a filename and backs up the configuration to this file.
Preprocessed_Description: backup use backup create backup policy manager configuration data arguments entered system automatically generates filename backs configuration file

Description: Use the cluster diagnostics command to run diagnostics on a Policy Manager cluster. This command supports both IPv4 and IPv6 management port addresses and uses port number 7432 to collect diagnostics data. Cluster diagnostics for both IPv4 and Ipv6 environments also include metrics for how much time was taken to establish a database connection to the publisher, and how much time was taken for HTTPS API calls to the publisher. These Publisher database connection check and HTTPS connection check to host duration metrics are in hour:min:sec.microsec format.
Preprocessed_Description: cluster diagnostics use cluster diagnostics run diagnostics policy manager cluster supports ipv4 ipv6 management port addresses uses port number 7432 collect diagnostics data cluster diagnostics ipv4 ipv6 environments also include metrics much time taken establish database connection publisher much time taken https api calls publisher publisher database connection check https connection check host duration metrics hour min format

Description: Use the drop-subscriber command to remove a specific subscriber node from the cluster.
Preprocessed_Description: cluster drop-subscriber use remove specific subscriber node cluster

Description: Use the cluster list command to list all the nodes in the cluster, and show whether cluster high availability is enabled or disabled. The cluster list command also indicates the cluster communication mode (IPv4 or IPv6), and indicates whether a standby publisher and failover wait time been defined.
Preprocessed_Description: cluster list use cluster list list nodes cluster show whether cluster high availability enabled disabled cluster list also indicates cluster communication mode ipv4 ipv6 indicates whether standby publisher failover wait time defined

Description: Use the cluster make-publisher command to promote a specific subscriber to be the publisher in the same cluster.
Preprocessed_Description: cluster make-publisher use cluster promote specific subscriber publisher cluster

Description: Run the cluster make-subscriber command on a standalone publisher to make the standalone node a subscriber node and add it to the cluster.
Preprocessed_Description: cluster make-subscriber run cluster standalone publisher make standalone node subscriber node add cluster

Description: Use the reset-database command to reset the local database and erase its configuration.
Preprocessed_Description: cluster reset database use reset local database erase configuration

Description: Use the cluster set-cluster-passwd command to change the cluster password on all nodes in the cluster. You may only issue this command from the publisher.
Preprocessed_Description: cluster set-cluster-passwd use cluster change cluster password nodes cluster may issue publisher

Description: cluster set-communication-mode [ipv4/ipv6]
Preprocessed_Description: cluster set communication mode cluster

Description: Use the cluster set-standby-publisher command to set a standby publisher for cluster high availability. You may only issue this command from the publisher.
Preprocessed_Description: cluster set-standby-publisher use cluster set standby publisher cluster high availability may issue publisher

Description: Use the cluster sync-cluster-passwd command to synchronize the cluster (appadmin) password currently set on the publisher with all the subscriber nodes in the cluster.
Preprocessed_Description: cluster sync-cluster-passwd use cluster synchronize cluster appadmin password currently set publisher subscriber nodes cluster

Description: Use the configure date command to specify the cluster's primary and secondary NTP (Network Time Protocol) servers, the key index, key value, encryption type, and optionally, the time zone for the publisher.
Preprocessed_Description: configure date use configure date specify cluster primary secondary ntp network time protocol servers key index key value encryption type optionally time zone publisher

Description: Use the configure dns command to configure DNS servers. You must specify a minimum of one DNS server; you can specify a maximum of three DNS servers.
Preprocessed_Description: configure dns use configure dns configure dns servers must specify minimum one dns server specify maximum three dns servers

Description: Use the configure fips-mode command to enable or disable FIPS (Federal Information Processing Standard) mode.
Preprocessed_Description: configure fips-mode use configure enable disable fips federal information processing standard mode

Description: Use the configure hostname command to configure the host name of the Policy Manager server. When configuring a host name that includes a period character ( . ), the substring before the first period character must be unique for each device. This is because a hostname field that includes a period character is interpreted to be a Fully Qualified Domain Name (FQDN), in which case the substring before the first period character is the hostname.
Preprocessed_Description: configure hostname use configure hostname configure host name policy manager server configuring host name includes period character substring first period character must unique device hostname field includes period character interpreted fully qualified domain name fqdn case substring first period character hostname

Description: Use the configure ip command to configure the IPv4 address of the management interface or the data interface, netmask, and gateway address.
Preprocessed_Description: configure ip use configure ip configure ipv4 address management interface data interface netmask gateway address

Description: Use the configure ip6 command to configure the IPv6 management or data interface, IPv6 address/PrefixLength, and the gateway address.
Preprocessed_Description: configure ip6 use configure ip6 configure ipv6 management data interface ipv6 gateway address

Description: Use the configure mtu command to set the MTU (Maximum Transmission Unit) for the management and data port interfaces.
Preprocessed_Description: configure mtu use configure mtu set mtu maximum transmission unit management data port interfaces

Description: This command is used to filter inbound or outbound traffic on a selected port.
Preprocessed_Description: configure port used filter inbound outbound traffic selected port

Description: Use the configure timezone command to interactively configure the time zone. The Policy Manager command-line interface prompts you to enter a continent or ocean, a country, and for countries with more than one time zone, also the region where your Policy Manager server is located.
Preprocessed_Description: configure timezone use configure timezone interactively configure time zone policy manager interface prompts enter continent ocean country countries one time zone also region policy manager server located

Description: Use the dump certchain command to remove the certificate chain of any SSL-secured server.
Preprocessed_Description: dump certchain use dump certchain remove certificate chain server

Description: Use the dump logs command to remove Policy Manager application log files. If you are working with Aruba technical support, you can use the dump logs command to tag a .tar file of log messages with a date, and server and company information, then upload that file to an Aruba log server.
Preprocessed_Description: dump logs use dump logs remove policy manager application log files working aruba technical support use dump logs tag file log messages date server company information upload file aruba log server

Description: Use the dump servercert command to remove the server certificate of an SSL-secured server.
Preprocessed_Description: dump servercert use dump servercert remove server certificate server

Description: Use the help command to display the list of supported Policy Manager commands:
Preprocessed_Description: help use help display list supported policy manager commands

Description: Use the Linux ldapsearch command to find objects in an LDAP directory. Note that only the Policy Manager-specific command line arguments are listed. For other command line arguments, refer to ldapsearch man pages on the Internet.
Preprocessed_Description: ldapsearch use linux ldapsearch find objects ldap directory note policy line arguments listed line arguments refer ldapsearch man pages internet

Description: Use the network ip command to add, delete, or list custom routes to the data or management interface routing table for IPv4 networks. Note that network IP routing commands are disabled for ClearPass cloud deployments (such as deployments hosted in Azure or AWS) because:
Preprocessed_Description: network ip use network ip add delete list custom routes data management interface routing table ipv4 networks note network ip routing commands disabled clearpass cloud deployments deployments hosted azure aws

Description: Test the reachability of the host on an IPv4 network
Preprocessed_Description: network ping test reachability host ipv4 network

Description: Test the reachability of the host on an IPv6 network
Preprocessed_Description: network ping6 test reachability host ipv6 network

Description: Use the network reset command to reset the network data and management ports. You can use this command to reset both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses. Before resetting an IPv4 address for the port, ensure than an IPv6 address is set for the port and that the cluster communication mode is set to IPv6. Conversely, before resetting an IPv6 address for the port, ensure that an IPv4 address is set for it and that the cluster communication mode is set to IPv4. Before Policy Manager resets an IPv4 or IPv6 address, it displays the warning message "This command erases network management port configuration and reconfigures the network. This might cause the system to lose network connectivity and require you to log in again."
Preprocessed_Description: network reset use network reset reset network data management ports use reset ipv4 ipv6 addresses resetting ipv4 address port ensure ipv6 address set port cluster communication mode set ipv6 conversely resetting ipv6 address port ensure ipv4 address set cluster communication mode set ipv4 policy manager resets ipv4 ipv6 address warning message erases network management port configuration reconfigures network might cause system lose network connectivity require log

Description: Print the route taken to reach the IPv6 network host.

Description: Print the route taken to reach the IPv6 network host.
Preprocessed_Description: network traceroute 6 print route taken reach ipv6 network host

Description: Use the network nslookup command to get the IP address of the host using DNS.

Description: Support engineers use this password to generate the recovery key for the Policy Manager server.

Description: The system install-image command installs a fresh image of the major product version specified in the second partition of a Policy Manager hardware appliance.

Description: Use the system morph-vm command to convert an evaluation virtual machine (VM) to a production virtual machine. With this command, licenses are still required to be installed after the morph operation is completed.
Preprocessed_Description: system morph-vm use system convert evaluation virtual machine vm production virtual machine licenses still required installed morph operation completed

Description: The system patch-rollback command allows a user with appadmin credentials to revert to the most recent installed version of Policy Manager. For example, if a Policy Manager system is at .1 and cumulative update .x is applied, Policy Manager can be reverted to .1 through the system patch-rollback command.

Description: Refresh the newly added or removed network adapters in Policy Manager so that they are reflected in the system. This command also enforces network adapter ordering and associates the lower-order MAC address to eth0 and the next higher-order MAC address to eth1, and so on. Ensure that you have the console session available.
Preprocessed_Description: system refresh-network refresh newly added removed network adapters policy manager reflected system also enforces network adapter ordering associates mac address eth0 next mac address eth1 ensure console session available

Description: This command allows an administrator to specify the passphrase (key) for LUKS encryption. The LUKS passphrase has a minimum length of eight characters. When this command is used, the new passphrase replaces the default LUKS key in ClearPass. Each time Policy Manager is rebooted or a new session is initiated, the administrator will be prompted to enter the specified LUKS passphrase before access is granted. As part of this feature, users should be aware that:
Preprocessed_Description: system update-luks-key allows administrator specify passphrase key luks encryption luks passphrase minimum length eight characters used new passphrase replaces default luks key clearpass time policy manager rebooted new session initiated administrator prompted enter specified luks passphrase access granted part feature users aware
